result.execSummary:
The defendant Tiffany D Wade was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered. Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Concurrent with: CONCURRENT with credit for 487 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain employment and/or school and/or vocational training.
Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
DO NOT frequent places where alcohol or illegal drug are sold, distributed or used.

Cognitive intervention programming.
COURT DOES NOT SUSPEND DRIVING PRIVILEGES.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol. Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
Use a physician disclosure form.

superTimeConds.notes: Court order 100 hours, annually, of community service at a non-profit organization.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tiffany D Wade

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment pursuant to Wis. Stats. Sec. 973.195.  THE COURT ORDERS: The petition for sentence adjustment is DENIED because it is not in the public interest.  Signed and filed.  Copies to parties.  lms
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Ellen R. Brostrom, Br. 6, for review. mag
Count two.
Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (38 pages) commencing OCTOBER 19, 2015 received and filed. kl
Received and filed, from Ellison Chapel.  lms

Defendant Tiffany D Wade in court with attorney Scott Franklin Anderson.  Defendant Tiffany D Wade in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defense address some minor descrepencies in the PSI.

Statements made as to sentencing.  Additional statements by: Earlie W. and Boston E.

CONCURRENT:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS, with credit for 487 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  The defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Cognitive intervention programming.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Use a physician disclosure form.
* DO NOT frequent places where alcohol or illegal drug are sold, distributed or used.
* Court order 100 hours, annually, of community service at a non-profit organization.
* Obtain and maintain employment and/or school and/or vocational training.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

COURT DOES NOT SUSPEND DRIVING PRIVILEGES

 Filed,

Defendant Tiffany D Wade in court with attorney Robert Lee Taylor.  Defendant Tiffany D Wade in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Calendar call scheduled for July 14, 2015 at 05:00 pm.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  
   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
